intro: Chilocarpus aurantiacus, commonly known as the golden-fruit tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers and broad, leathery leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation. The tree produces small, edible fruits that are an important food source for various wildlife species.
